I guess I thought that for all the critique Emeril gives Top Chef stars, his restaurant would blow me away.

The homemade truffle chips were good, and somewhat unique, but perhaps a little over cooked, leaving a numb of chips hard.

Our steaks were indeed prepared excellently, and a quality cut of meat. I had the filet, which was an ample serving and cooked to a perfect medium rare.

But the twice baked potatoes were a big disappointment. The shells seems to be way overcooked, to the point or requiring a steak knife to cut through them. The flavor was bland, even with cheddar and bacon. A little salt and pepper certainly helped.

We did enjoy the creamed spinach, even including my colleague who usually doesn't like green things.

The bread pudding was definitely the way to go on dessert. We also had a slice of banana cream pie, but the star was the bread pudding, which was not ruined with raisins. It was rich, smooth, creamy and delicious.
Always fantastic. This place is a real gem in Las Vegas.

Exceptional...exceptional steakhouse!! Ordered ribeye bone out and I've never had such an amazing cut of meat in my life! I died and went to heaven! The service is phenomenal! Had a huge party of about 15 and everyone was well attended too! The sides are superb too! Such a great atmosphere! Sophisticated an chic! Loved loved this place! A MUST when visiting Vegas!

I went here for my friend's bachelor party's dinner.  I am not a steak person but after reading all the reviews here about the bone in rib eye and then hearing the waiter's description I was in for one.  I ordered it Medium Well.  When it came to the table I was expecting it to be tough, chewy, small, etc... When it arrived at the table it was a pretty big slab of meat and  when I cut into it and had my first slice it was totally opposite of what I was expecting.  It was soft, flavorful, and melted in your mouth.  I should have expected that instead since it was priced $52.  Best damn cooked to order piece of steak I have ever had to this day =)

I took a group of eight to Delmonico for business. My party included a number of foodies, including a couple that prided themselves on having been to the best steakhouses around. Most people had steak and Delmonico fared extremely well, with one person saying it was one of the two best steakhouses he had ever been to. We enjoyed the appetizers -- Emeril sure knows his barbequed shrimp! Sides were excellent, including asparagus, creamed corn, and au gratin potatoes. I had the salmon, which was extremely flavorful and perfectly prepared (despite being farm raised). The wine list is extensive and impressive, although finding a reasonably priced bottle was a challenge. Service was truly exceptional.\n\nWe had appetizers to share for the whole table, top-end entrees, and two desserts.  Also quite a few bottles of wine (albeit on the lower end of the price list) and several after dinner drinks.  With tax and tip the meal was a bit over $150/person.  Clearly not a budget place, but for a top Las Vegas restaurant and for the amount we ordered I thought this very reasonable.  You could easily blow the budget on that wine list though!
I didn't get a chance to eat here but the mojitos were absolutely divine. they make their own rum in house and could easily be the elixir of the gods. worth the time, every time. highly recommend.

Again, just wandering Vegas and was hungry so I stumbled in here. I dont really like the ambiance of the place. The decor was blah. It was not minimalist, it was just blah. Anyways, onto the food.

The steak was good, but not as good as others Ive had. The stand out was the BBQ shrimp appetizer and the lobster bisque. Those 2 made the meal. The BBQ shrimp was in a gumbo like sauce, but it was so good. And then I dipped the bread into the sauce too. The lobster bisque was perfect.  IT came out in a sauce pan and they poured it into my bowl.

Service was great, I think I had like 3 servers.

Hands down the best meal and service I have ever had! We all did the three course special which was great and the portions were triple the size what I thought they would be! Michael and Drew were awesome waiters and made sure everything was perfect. I know my family will talk about that night for years to come!

We were sat at 9:15. Dinner arrived at 10:45...  Those of us not drinking wine were not offered anything other than water. Once dinner arrived a couple of the steaks were placed in front of the wrong patrons. Instead of just correcting the issues, the server/manager restated what I ordered (the bone in NY strip). The steak in front of me was very clearly a filet. Our wine glasses were not cleared until our dinner plates were...
The steaks were decent. Not amazing, but adequate...  
Restroom was dirty, toilet seat damaged, no hand towels. 
A relatively pitiful attempt at a fine dining experience.

So, after several years of not eating at an restaurant of Mr. Lagasse, I finally made it to Delmonico's.  Why might you ask?  Well for one reason - the bone in aged rib-eye steak.

This was the third Emeril restaurant that I've eaten at.  I used to live in New Orleans and ate at his first restaurant, Emeril's, and his casual outpost, NOLA, several times.  The food was good at times, not so great at other times, but the one thing that was constant was the excellent service.  

Delmonico's continues that tradition.  The service is excellent.  At times, it's a little too friendly, but attentive and not overbearing.  Food came out at a very good pace, allowing for long conversations without interruption.  And the decor is so understated and clean.  It really is a nice change from all of the typical Vegas restaurants with loud lighting and faux-glam decor.

Because my girlfriend was so eager to try Emeril's food (she's a big fan), we started off with some classics - barbecued shrimp (New Orleans style) and shrimp cocktail with remoulade sauce.  The lunch menu usually has shrimp remoulade over fried green tomatoes.  However, it wasn't on the menu and I really wanted my girlfriend to try it.  The waiter was nice enough to accommodate my request, learned they had some prepared and served it with the shrimp cocktail.  To drink, she ordered a glass of Loosen Bros.  "Dr. L Estate" Riesling and I ordered a glass of Laurent Perrier NV Champagne. 

The Riesling was recommended by the Asst. Sommelier.  The waiter initially recommended an Australian white blend.  But to me, it didn't seem like the best match with the barbecued shrimp because it lacked the acidity to cut the richness of the dish.  When I commented to the Sommelier that I thought the Australian white had Viognier in it, he said it definitely did.  As we talked more, he said the Riesling was a "perfect match" for the barbecued shrimp.  You know what?  It was.  My girlfriend wolfed down half of the barbecued shrimp, taking a sip of the Riesling with each bite.  She even raved - it was a perfect match.  And she also loved the remoulade.  The barbecued shrimp were cooked well, I noticed one of the shrimp I had was a little tough, but the remaining shrimp were plump and juicy.  The shrimp cocktail was great.  Cold, large shrimp, moist, juicy and firm.  They were perfect with the remoulade sauce.

From there, we split the bone-in rib eye which was cooked ABSOFRIGGINLUTELY PERFECTLY MED-RARE TO MED.  It wasn't charred, but had that crunch of a good high-temp seared steak.  The twice baked potato with bacon and cheese was sinfully great.  The asparagus was sauteed with garlic and shallots, cooked perfectly through with still a slight crunch.  We shared a half bottle of 2003 Pine Ridge Crimson Creek Merlot which was a good match for the steak.  It had good balance, acidity, but enough soft fruit to please my girlfriend, who doesn't like tannic wines.

Dessert was banana cream pie for her, pecan pie for me.  Both were excellent.  The banana cream pie wasn't as sweet as expected, which made it even more easy to eat.  She ordered an espresso martini made with espresso (not the flavored vodka), I ordered a glass of 2003 Carmes de Rieussec Sauternes and finished with a cup of chicory coffee to finish.

Was it inexpensive? Of course not.  It was quite expensive.  But for the excellent quality of food (far, far, far better than Gallagher's and probably the second best only to Bouchon of the restaurants I've eaten at in Vegas) and the best service I've had in Vegas (yes, better than Bouchon), it was worth it.  

Why 5 stars?  Because everything went right.  Was the service perfect? Almost.  Was the food perfect?  Almost.  Were the drinks perfect?  Almost.  Adding that all together with the right person I wanted to share the evening with, it was perfect.  (Although I didn't ever finish my French Laundry review, that place IS nearly perfect with whoever you go with.  It is still to this day, the best eating experience I have ever had and I've had the fortune of going there 3 times now.)

Now if I could only remember the name of the Asst. Sommelier, I would give him a shout out here.  

I am once again a fan of Emeril.  But please, no "BAM."

BAM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Emeril has done good!

ITs located in the venetian casino level on restaurant row on the way to the palazzo. the place has a cute bar area where we had to wait for the rest of our party but eventually the hostess sat us first. we had to sit at 2 seperate tables because we had 13people BUT they didnt charge gratuity...although we gave more regardless...

from the start our server was beyond nice and welcoming. he helped ben choose his martini, he helped me and a friend chose our red wine which was yummy and we devoured our calamari, filet mignon, bonein ribeye, truffle chips and mushrooms!!!

the bread they bring out one by one on your plate was SO soft, warm and goooood with the butter, calamari was wonderful even with olives (which im not a big fan of) it was yummy, the filetmignon was cooked well all the way around perfectly seasoned. the ribeye was a REAL winner though super yummmy and HUGGE (obviously hence the place being called delmonico...). the mushrooms were perfect and the truffle chips were delish altho a little TOO greasy for me. 

alll the food runners and our server was so nice and the atmosphere like many steakhouses wasnt stuck up but actually really relaxed while still being rather nice. at the end he asked us where we were heading and suggested many different places to check out even tho we were so picky on tryin to decide which bar to head too. he also brought out two desserts with a candle for the two bday boys at our table!

at the end our table of 6 had a bill of near $450  (5 of us got filet or ribeye $45-$55) Ben F and I ate $190 worth hahahah it was a wonderful meal...in a wonderful atmosphere! check it out when in need of a fabulous steak + great wine.

During a recent visit to Las Vegas, Delmonico Steakhouse was one of our top priorities. We had heard wonderful things about the food and this review was echoed when our driver commented that Delmonico was "one of the best steakhouses in the world." Upon arriving we felt like VIP guests. The bar was sleek and high class. We were there to celebrate and friend's upcoming move and this was the perfect setting. The dining room was tastefully decorated and the minimalistic style allowed us to focus on the delicious food and good company. Among the appetizers we tried our favorites were the Foie Gras and Crabcakes. The appetizers set the tone for what would be an incredible dining experience. I suppose it should go without saying but the next course was STEAK! Filets and Bone-in Ribeyes were the popular picks with the guest of honor going for the Filet Oscar (a filet topped with jumbo crab meat), which was the group's favorite. The steaks lived up to their reputation. The sides were a la carte and were great for sharing. And it was all tied together with a Sineann Pinot Noir from the expansive wine list. We enjoyed the meal so much we did not get a chance to try the dessert menu. Service was outstanding. Our server, Michael, was very attentive and enhanced the entire experience. Everyone ranked our evening at Delmonico amongst their favorite dining experiences. The food, drinks and service were top-notch and it was the perfect send-off for a good friend.

Delmonico's is an interesting venue for dining. 
My first impression was that the decor was very understated for a "quality dining"experience.
As we waited a short time for our table to be prepared, we were invited to the lounge and bar - it was not impressive.
The table selection, at first seemed unimpressive, but after a short while we began to appreciate our location.
We were seated near the entrance to the dining room, but were hoping for a table deep into the interior.
Asthe evening proceeded, we found that we could have a very fine conversation, while those dining well into the room had to raise the level of their conversation just to be heard over the din coming from  the remainder of the room.  
The first component of the five star trating came with the extensive wine list.
The wine list will amaze anyone. A selection for every taste .....  
The service is also five star. Any need you have will be well attended at Delmonico's.
I have a hard time believing that I went to one of the very best steakhouses in Las Vegas and ordered Salmon.
I thought if Emeril Lagasse is associated with this steakhouse then the fish selections would be first rate.
I was not wrong !
I enjoyed the crabcake appetizer -  it was just supurb.
The BBQ Salmon was astoundingly good and cooked to perfection. 
A wealth of flavor in every bite. 
The steaks ordered by the rest of the table were huge and exceedingly good.
The table shared a chocolate blackberry cake for desert and it was the perfect pair for a fine selection of tawny Port.
Once again, the service provided by the staff was excellent throughout the meal. 
Simply an amazing dining experience.
First class all the way ...........

Steak and sides were tasty although not nearly as well prepared or delicious as the food at Ruth's Chris. The pecan pie desert was actually the best part of the meal and the chicory coffee was horrible. Wine list offered $40.00 bottles of wine for over $100.00. Service was excellent which it should be when your paying so much money for your food. Ruth's Chris is much better steak and sides for less money. A fun experience but will not be back for a long time.
Steak that melts in your mouth.  Crispy, flavorful asparagus & attentive service.  \nEverything that came out of the kitchen was perfect.

was there this past weekend with a group of 7 people... not a disappointed person in the party. the staff was super friendly and accomodating (we had children with us). i had mushroom crusted filet medallions. so good. we got sides of grits, corn and steamed broccoli... all three were great. we also ordered a few desserts, the banana cream pie was outrageous. so fresh and tasty. i didnt have the wine but my friends really enjoyed the bottle that was recommended to them.

I've heard mixed reviews from friends for Delmonico but I really enjoyed it! Too bad I stuffed myself during brunch at Bouchon, I really wanted to try more at Delmonico.

+ easy to make reservations via Opentable.com (in fact I changed my reservation easily via smartphone)
+ great location in the Venetian/Palazzo restaurant row; close to multiple show theaters
+/- huge restaurant (didn't notice from outside but there's a lot of tables)
- sitting by the kitchen; another group asked to be moved too because the bus boys run in and out of there like their shoes were on fire, it was kind of nerve-wrecking to watch them
- the place wasn't 100% packed even though it was Christmas so I don't understand why the wait service was meh (no butter, no bread until after appetizers, slow to refill water, etc.)
+ waiter hadn't come back to take our order and a manger (or whatever the guys in the suit vs. the aprons are called) stepped in
+ we ordered the Chateaubriand $105 (for 2) for the 3 of us ("no, it's not frowned upon" haha)
+/- the sides that came w/ the meat was okay (the mashed potatoes wasn't as bad as everyone says and the asparagus was so forced - it's not even in season right now)
+/- Traditional New Orleans Gumbo $10 was not worth it - it was decent but I wouldn't order it again or recommend it to anyone (and whats up with serving it in a small sauce pan on the bowl, then pouring it into the bowl - does that mean that pan was just on the stove top aka dirty? and I didn't even get a chance to pick out all the green onion before it got mixed in, sigh)
+ Vine-Ripened Heirloom Tomato Salad $17- pricey but it was tasty and this is coming from someone that doesn't like tomato unless it's in salsa form
+ tasty wine and hefty wine BINDER ;-)

We debated ordering a dessert but none of it sounded appetizing. If you can get it at the buffet, save the calories.

I may come back to try some more stuff but there are so many more restaurants I need to try the next time I'm back in Vegas.

Nice atmosphere and wonderful service. I had the dinner special which was a wedge salad, a petite ribeye, and desert.   

The salad was as expected. Nothing to jump up and down about. The petite ribeye was tasty. Just a minute over cooked, but overall it was good. The desert was ice cream and cake. As I'm not a cake eater I can't tell you about that, but the ice cream was good. 

Overall, it was a pleasant dinner.

3.5

I had high hopes for Delmonico, as many had said some great things.  Being an Emeril restaurant I figured it was just another celebrity chef restaurant, so I had my reservations.  The place was well decorated and had a great vibe.  The food was up to par and certain items had great taste, such as the lobster bisque.  I was hoping for more with the wilted spinach salad, but it was still OK.  The complimentary amuse bouche was a nice touch, tasted like a truffle cream of mushroom.  Now the steak, everyone says to go with the bone-in ribeye, so that's what I got.  Tasty, but needed a bit more flavor.  Not as buttery and smooth as other high end steakhouses.  Service could use some attention for a restaurant of this caliber.  Forgot our truffle potato chips and service went downhill with the way they took our plates and such.

Not sure I'd go back with all the other many celebrity chef restaurants to try, but it's definitely one of the better ones.

Took my girlfriend to Vegas for her birthday (and secretly, to propose), and was planning to take her to a nice dinner.  Went to Delmonico on a suggestion from a trusted friend, and damn, glad I did.  He may be annoyingly over the top on TV, but Emeril and company know what they're doing.

Right from the beginning wait to be seated, until the ending dessert and coffee, we had a great time with great food.  In a "that is so Vegas" twist, our waiter looked like Wayne Newton.  They were great on recommending drinks and pick of entrees, and answered all questions off the menu.  Service was even to such a level that they helped my lady with her seat, which is good, since the chairs are heavy. 

As to the food. . . *glarg* *drool*  Sorry, I get moisture in my mouth thinking about it.  Shrimp the size of my thumb after I hit it with a hammer covered in a fantastic spicy cream sauce, steak that you could cut with a spoon, a portion of the most tender venison I've ever had, that was just as good when cold the next day (because I couldn't eat all of it), a martini that made it harder to walk out of there than the amount of food I ate, incredible desserts, and well, an espresso menu that involved such quality coffee I had no idea coffee that good existed.

I don't eat at high caliber steakhouses on a weekly basis or anything, but I've been to a few, and it's not like DC has a shortage of them given the wealth there.  Vegas is the same sort of way -- artificial city with lots of money -- and damn if Delmonico didn't top anything I've had so far when it comes to high caliber steak places.  

And in case you're wondering -- she said yes.  I'm sure that was in part due to this dinner. ;)

~EEE~

This is what a steakhouse ought to be. Located in the Venetian/Palazzo complex, it's divided into several rooms, all pleasantly decorated. The ambience is relaxed and friendly. The wait staff is attentive without being overbearing. There's none of the pretense you get at, say Carnevino in the same hotel complex. There is a nice energy level but you can easily hear each other.

We brought a wine bottle from home and the wait staff was fine with it. They politely informed us of the corkage fee (a reasonable $30) without making us feel weird about having brought our own bottle the way some places do.

We started with a very tasty shrimp cocktail to share. Then I moved on to the Piedmontese boneless strip steak, which was delicious. Helen had the salmon, which was like butter. Potatoes au gratin made a nice side.

Everything was perfectly cooked, impeccable in quality, and served with refined flair.

So overall the food was amazing - we had shrimp and biscuit for appetizer with a delicious romaine salad, then filet mignon. The bread was to die for, the ambiance, and service were excellent...why not 5? \n\nMy steak was overcooked...I ordered medium, it was well...and this is a steak house. However, everything else was very well prepared and delicious. I will give them another try my next time in vegas!

My husband and I dined here for my 40th birthday. We were treated like royalty and loved every minute. He had the chateaubriand and I had the salmon. Both were incredible. I can't wait to visit Vegas again just to eat here!

Went there for the thanksgiving dinner. What a mistake! Dry turkey with horrible tasting green beans. Also ordered mojitos and they were the worse I've had. I do not know about the rest of the menu but the thanksgiving dinner was overpriced and gross. The two stars are for the dinner roles and the parmesan chips.

Let the 5 star rating speak for itself. Absolutely delicious mind blowing steaks served here. The bone-in ribeye was grilled to perfection. Topped with butter. Seriously, could you ask for anything more. I had tears welling up in my eyes it was so good. I was having a moment. Tender beyond belief. The cajun rub did not taste cajun. It tasted like seasoned perfection.

Excellent sides and appetizers. Wine list, extensive. Decor wasn't my style but very simple - nothing to write home about. The staff was very attentive, helpful, and courteous. 

Again. Mind blowing!

7 girls, after a long 4 hour drive, arrived at the Venetian on a mission for some hearty steak.  Delmonico was the answer to our problem.  We were so exhausted that we didn't even bother pretty-ing ourselves up before hand...dumped out bags and headed straight to dinner.  We were worried that our shorts and flip-flop attire wasn't going to cut it but aside from some dirty stares from some of the other guests, the wait staff kindly turned their heads.  

The service was impeccable.   They started us off with a goat cheese puff pastry to cleanse our pallets, compliments of the chef.  All of us buddied up and ordered the Bone-in Ribeye Steak...which was plenty to go around.  Tasty, it sure was but I'd have to say, I've had better.  The garlic mushrooms, creamed corn, cheddar bacon grits, and sauteed asparagus sides were great compliments set in the middle of the table for all of us to share.  We were seated at a circular table which was ideal for conversation instead of screaming across a long table.  By dessert, we were stuffed...next time for sure.  

Since we didn't order any wine to compliment the dinners that we all split, Delmonico left the robbing of our $$ to the casinos.  I know if I went with just my boyfriend, it'd be one less night we could stay at the Venetian.

Too much of anything is bad, but too much good whiskey is barely enough - M. Twain

Loaded with more whiskey than most whiskey drinkers will ever try, I think Delmonico still boasts the largest selection of whiskey in Vegas...I know they did in the recent past. Either way, there are a plethora of whiskey options to elevate your safe, Emeril, food choices while at Delmonico. 

Delmonico is also home to a fantastic craft cocktail program...seriously one of the best in town...and also the reason that you should visit every so often. This as actually rather troublesome for me because given their range of whiskeys I'm forced to choose between flights whiskey, pours of favorites that you can't find most places and excellent craft cocktails...and the craft cocktails include every type of spirit, so even the problematic non-whiskey lovers can enjoy something amazing.

Suffice it to say, Delmonico is home to 5 star adult beverages with typical 3.5 star Emeril Lagasse food.

Went here over the past weekend just to try. Have been to other steakhouses like cut, Ruth cris, morels, summit house in Fullerton, and lawrys. Safe to say food was decent considering the price. 

Filet mingnon was tender but good. Not great. I have liked the filet at cut much better. 

Crab legs were bland but amazingly precut and offered at either a cold or hot temperature. 

The lobster bisque was ok too. I think I had expected the greatness I found with McCormick's lobster bisque. Safe to say for the price I would probably go to cut again or lawrys or McCormick. Probably wouldn't want to go back here. Sorry kids. But that's just me.

Celebrated hubby's birthday here.  The whole experience was top notch from the service, the food, and the attention to detail.  The moment we walked into the restaurant, the host greeted us by saying "Happy Birthday" to my hubby, which started the night great for us.  For once, I didn't get a side eye or a raised eyebrow when I asked my steak to be well-done; there was no snobby attitude from our server, and all the food we ordered was cooked to perfection.  Hubby ordered the bone-in ribeye (medium), I ordered regular ribeye, and we shared twice baked potato.  Their portions were so generous that we had no room for dessert.  Specialty cocktails didn't live up to my expectation and was a bit of a let down, but deceptively strong so worth the money.  Over all, really great first time experience here.  Oh, and a shoutout to our server Dale, who was nice, witty, and took care of us.

How could anyone give this place less than 5 stars.  The food is great.  Everything went perfectly.  I wish I could eat here everyday...  I usually split the Chateaubriand with a friend.  I would recommend Delmonico to everyone that wants an amazing experience with great food.

Regards,

Adam

I took my wife here for our anniversary last year. The service was outstanding (I think we had three waiters just for our table) and the food was excellent. I had the sea bass and she had the pork chops, both were cooked perfectly and tasted wonderful. For desert they had root beer ice cream and I swear it felt like it was carbonated. The decor was OK but they could do a little more.
Good steak, good wine, good grits, no complaints...minus the bill

Hints: Bone-In Rib Steaks
Bone-In Rib Steaks
Bone-In Rib Steaks
Bone-In Rib Steaks
Bone-In Rib Steaks
Bone-In Rib Steaks
Ok, you should get it by now.

More Hints: 
The mushroom sauce is too salty for my taste bud.
Service is always excellent every time I come here for dinner.
Bone-In Rib Steaks is always cooked to perfection, everything else here is just average .

One last Hint: 
Bone-In Rib Steaks
AOL Keyword: Bone-in ribeye

The pro: The steaks here are the best. Actually even the appetizer and the side dishes are excellent. We ordered the calamari and homemade chips (really tasty) as our appetizers. The asparagus was enough for all four of us to eat (and only $9) the baked potato was hella good too.\n\nThe con: It is very pricey, steaks start off at about $48, but well worth it. Even if you can only eat here once just do it, very tasty.
Great service from the get go! The steak fish are delicious but please save room for emerils banana cream pie omg it's  the best.\nWhen in Vegas always make sure to eat at emerils restaurants.

If you're looking for good steak, you go to Delmonico.

This place is classy as hell and I loved it. The waiter was very nice and knowledgeable and a funny guy.

The bone in ribeye was perfect. Medium rare, juice oozed out, flavor exploded. Exactly what you want. The grits were good too, but the cheesy potato side was a standout.

We had a hair in our dessert and our waiter brought over the manager, comped the dessert and gave us another dessert on top of that! The caramel cake and the creme brle were good ways to end the night.

Honestly, I want to live in the steak.

The excellent: 1) Waiter Frank was very helpful and personable and was dead-on with food recommendations! 2) the barbeque shrimp was the highlight of the meal; its sauce was so flavorful and a definite must-get item! 3) very nice touch of congratulatory dish written in chocolate and complementary dessert! The bad: we received NY strips instead of rib-eyes and steak not impressive at all; did not taste like it was a prime cut - too lean and very little flavor, although foie gras was cooked perfectly. Restaurant touts of 7 week aged beef but couldn't tell - have had more flavorful steaks from Costco. Won't go here again because of the unimpressive steak quality, even though service, ambiance, and appetizer was excellent.

If you want a perfectly executed, consistent steak, this place is where you go.  Everything is the gold standard.   I had a medium rare ribeye that was wonderful.  Sides were great and the bread.... so good that you can just eat the bread alone.\n\nMy biggest issue, it's boring.  Really boring.  If you've had an expense account like me due to work, you eat at these places every month and although it's great, it gets boring.   Same type of people, same type of customers, dressed the same way.     I know... first world problems.

I think this place can serve bologna sandwiches and still get a 5-star rating solely based on how good their customer service and wait staff is here! We started out with the fried oysters and the petite wedge salads. The oysters were incredibly fresh and crispy. Do the pro move and ask the waiter to bring out some crystals hot sauce to put on the top if you really want to make it Cajun, also smeared some blue cheese on top of mine from my wife salad which made it over the top good. For the main course we split the Chateaubriand and the cut was really  nice and seasoned and came with a side of asparagus and Lebanese potatoes. On our next visit I think we will stick with getting just the bone in ribeye as it looked a little better and then ordering our sides ala carte. For dessert we had the banana cream pie which was not overly sweet and the contrast  with the chocolate shavings on top giving it that slight bitter taste mixing with that creamy goodness.  The cappuccino was very good and was the excellent end cap to an extraordinary meal.

This place is about as bland as vanilla ice cream.... there is no style to the dining room, the service is slow and quiet, the steaks well... I have had much better... the only good is the deserts are very good, and the palce has a great wine list (albeit very pricey)... Vegas can do better (and it does)
I enjoyed my food good price great service but i have had better but would definetly will come here again

Excellent steakhouse. Well designed to be classy with some modern touches but not too modern you don't feel like you aren't in an old fashioned steakhouse.

The filet mignon done au poive was superb (5/5). Not necessarily the most traditional prep but the cajun seasoning combined with the crusted pepper and very tender beef made for an awesome bite.

The bone in rib eye (5/5) was also cooked expertly and one of the most flavorful and not too fatty pieces of steak I've had.

The shrimp cocktail (3.5/5) was nice but I thought standard cocktail sauce would have been better. The slice of avocado and sprig of microgreens made it nice.

Service was on point and very professional. 

Would come back here again. Thought it was better than Cut Steakhouse in the Venetian.

We had early reservations for a party of 9 for my 40th birthday. We were seated at a lovely table and were all surprised how we could hear everyone without having to strain. This means the acoustics in the room we were in were spot on. 

Our waiter was Lamont and there were various other folks helping us out. We were all served warm buttery rolls that had both a salt and we are pretty sure bit of sugar sprinkling on them. Drinks were ordered by a few of us-I imbibed just a bit as it was my birthday after all and the drinks were good, reasonably priced and tasty. 

Everything we ate was wonderful. We started with 2 orders of house made potato chips with truffle oil and Parmesan. They were yummy and the perfect combination of salt and grease to help the booze go down easily. Some of us had starters, some of us chose not to. 

I had the lobster bisque to start and it was heavenly with perfectly cooked lobster and nice pieces of it. Others had the Gumbo (no seafood-heat but not hot), the heirloom tomato and Burrata cheese salad. There were also a couple of other appetizers ordered-BBQ Shrimp (delicious and unlike anything we had before) and Escargot(I was too chicken to try it).
Truffle Parmesan potato chips

For mains, people had 
Filets
Bone In Rib-eye 
Salmon
Scallops
Medallions of beef

Since sides are generous, we all shared:
Asparagus
Creamed Corn-delicious (and I make my own just as good)
Creamed Spinach (the most boring)
Sauteed Mushrooms-fabulous
Potato Gratin
Twice Baked Potatoes
Grits (meh-but not for me texturally)

We were all so full, we only ordered one dessert to share and that was the infamous Banana cream pie. Worth every bite and every calorie-in fact....

Kevin and I came back here for lunch our last day in Vegas!
We shared the BBQ shrimp, I had the lobster bisque again and he had the heirloom tomato salad. We also shared another slice of the banana cream pie and I would do it again in a heartbeat. 

Fabulous birthday dinner and wonderful company!

Finally made it here after wanting to go for so many years.  From the moment we got there we were greeted by the hosting area and whisked away to our table.  They pulled the chairs out for me and my guest and made sure we were comfortable.  They even asked if I wanted my jacket placed on the empty seat next to me, wow.  Head waiter came over and introduced himself and his team that were going to serve us for the night.  Sommelier came over and asked if I need any help picking out a wine.  being the wine geek that I am I had no problem browsing thru the incredible list/book and picked out a delicious red burgundy.  We ordered the truffled potato chips and boy were they good, yummo.  We skipped on a big appetizer because we didn't want to get too full.  We both ordered the Bone In RIb Eye and it was one of the best steaks I have ever eaten that I was sucking the tasty bone with no shame.  One incredible meal and one of the best I have had in Vegas.  This is the place and I will be back for sure...

Do not order the lamb!  It is 70 % fat or better.  They warned me but I just could not imagine that much fat could be on these chops! It was obscene!!  \n  The chips were very good ; and the liquor and wine lists are some of the most complete anywhere . \n  The servers behind the bar were attentive but it was REALLY obvious that they have a slight touch of  animosity toward the guests.  Perhaps here in Las Vegas the guests are a bit abusive , that may account for the latent attitude .  Mind you , they don't display it to your face , but if You keep your ears and eyes open ,  you can easily pick up on the glares and hushed cross talk between them .  Given the world as it is though , can anyone expect them to be anything but a little jaded?  All in all , 4 stars

I was very pleased with this restaurant.   
We were celebrating an anniversary and both maitre D and wait staff greeted us with "Happy Anniversary".
The restaurant itself was lovely, comfortable, and busy, but not noisy. We certainly had privacy at our table. 
The staff was helpful and considerate. The food was excellent and plentiful. Lots of variety and the staff was respectful of allergies/dietary restrictions. It was pricey, but we spent far less than we anticipated. 
My only regret is that we didn't have enough room for one of their fabulous desserts. 
I would not hesitate to dine there again.

Had an all around fine meal at Delmonico on our recent trip to Las Vegas.  I also went to Wolfgang Puck's CUT and gave it 4 stars on this trip.  The only real difference was that Delmonico cooked my NY Strip perfectly medium rare vs. just a bit over at Puck's place.  The rest of the meal from service to apps to salads was first rate.  The gumbo was yummy with a dark brick roux used and plenty of chicken, seafood and andouille to complement.  They put a big ole hunk of Maitre d butter on each steak and this, along with the Cajun seasoning (am assuming Emeril's trademark Essence) and the natural juices from the prime, aged beef lead to a wonderful liquid on your plate for dipping each tender bite.\n\nService was as attentive and on point as one would expect at these prices.  Sorry Wolfgang, Emeril wins this showdown by .5 of a star!

This place was the bomb-digity!  One of the best meals I've ever had.  I know they are known for the bone-in ribeye but go with the filet oscar style.   My crew and I were out for my bachelor party and we had a 10:30PM dinner and we ended up staying there till about 1 in the morning.  The wait staff was awesome, not pushy at all and very helpful.  Even joked with us a little bit.  We were definitely the last ones in the place but they were happy to let us stay as long as we wanted.  Highly recommend this place, very classy.

This place was EXCELLENT!  We were on the hunt for a great steakhouse and we definitely found it here.  The food and drinks were excellent and there were many options to choose from.  One thing I find in many upscale steakhouses is a somewhat limited menu with only a handful of entrees and appetizers to choose from.  Delmoico's has an expansive menu and everything was delicious.  the atmosphere and food made for a great night out... definitely try if you are looking for a nice night out (for steak) in Vegas!

Simply delicious!

I went with a group from work while attending a meeting and everyone seemed impressed with the food. We started off with a few appetizers including the calamari which was a little on the salty side, roasted butternut squash ravioli with duck and the crab cakes. 

I had the spinach and radicchio salad with apple rosemary vinaigrette and warm pistachio crusted goat cheesecake. Yep, that's right, you heard me... a goat cheese cake. It was fantastic. 

For my entre I was worried because I had already filled up on the appetizers and my delicious salad but I managed to eat my Filet Mignon medallions with a bacon peppercorn sauce.  We split a few sides as a table including the broccoli, asparagus and some delicious corn dish. I have no idea who ordered it but for the love of all that is holy, you have to get this corn dish. It was phenomenal. The broccoli not so much... too al dente for me!

For dessert there were a few orders of the bread pudding and banana cream pie which no one seemed to complain about. The service was a little slow but maybe it was because the place was packed. There was way too much time in between courses. Oh and it took at least 30 minutes to get drinks each round. Maybe go early before the rush hits or just don't go with a party of 13 like we did.

We had dinner reservations here at 6:00 on March 4th, & I was excited to eat here because I use so many of Emeril's recipes at home.  We were seated promptly.  However, I stumbled on a chicken leg on the way to our table, & it was all down hill from there.  The 16 oz. Ribeye was flavorful, but overpriced, considering it was almost 1/2 fat.  When my boyfriend commented, our waiter laughed & said, "that's typical for a Ribeye" & walked away.  After that, we didn't receive any further service from him.  I had the fried chicken, which was $38, & came with black-eyed peas that had no flavor.  Our drinks were just Tito's vodka and cranberry juice at about $14 each.  I had one piece of chicken, & we were done.  The atmosphere was not warm & inviting, & the flavorless food was definitely overpriced.  We were incredibly disappointed & will not eat here, again.
Second time dining at DelMonico.  Food was great service was on\nPoint. A must when in Las Vegas

This place is amazing!! This is our second time to visit Delmonico and we were equally as delighted as our first time. We really did it up...

For apps, we got the BBQ shrimp (awesome) and the oysters. Both are highly recommended.

My husband got the lobster bisque and I got the heirloom tomato salad.. the tomato salad was $18. Was that ridiculous? Yes. Was it worth it? Also yes. 

I got the filet medium done, and my husband got the bone-in rib eye medium rare. My steak was perfection.. my husbands was too medium.. The staff were quick to correct the error and apologetically brought him a new steak. Talk about wonderful service! 

We shared grits (so yummy and I am NOT a grits girl), and the asparagus. 

For dessert we sampled the banana cream pie.. like everything else we had, it was really special :)

Overall, this is a wonderful place to splurge! The service is accommodating and helpful.. the food is well worth the money, and the ambiance is great :)
Didn't eat.  Sat at bar and had wine.  Pretty reasonably priced considering it's vegas.  Wine by glass list well above average.  Very competent bartender.  Would return.

The food was really good, but I've had better.  The atmosphere was somewhat pretentious and uncomfortable, but nicely done.  $10 to add broccoli with my $62 steak seemed a bit gouging.

Service was above reproach.  Knowledgable and sincerely friendly staff.

Would I eat at Delmonico's again?  Absolutely.  But my expectations will be lower next time.

I'm soooo bummed! Wanted to love this place! Brought my hubby based on the reviews. Lobster bisque....amaze balls! Scallops......sooo salty they were not edible. Filet was raw even though I ordered it medium. Manager was so sorry that they comped the scallops, comped dessert, and comped a salad. Our whole meal was basically wrong or ruined. I'm glad they comped, but still.......umm probably won't be back. Bummer :(

I've eaten here twice, it was better a few years back. The steak wasn't that great quality in general for the steak. The sides and salads were excellent. I'm kind of upset that they share the name with the fantastic steakhouse Emeril owns in New Orleans.

I'm a big fan of Emeril's cooking and love his steakhouse within The Venetian hotel. I always stay at adjoining The Palazzo and love walking through both hotels to arrive at the restaurant. The filets are amazing! Perfectly cooked medium rare just the way I like it and wonderfully seasoned. Service is excellent with an extensive wine list. The BBQ shrimp is delicious and do try desserts. We had a fantastic dinner here. Thank you Emeril!

wonderful decor and ambiance.  simple, modern and elegant.  comfy chairs too.   as others have stated the restaurant is a little loud (which I liked) but the tables are spaced comfortably apart so you can still enjoy an intimate dinner.  

stellar service.  John and his group were attentive without being snooty and overbearing.  we felt comfortable.  i don't think there was ever a moment when our glasses reached half empty glass before they addressed it.  any little crumbs on the table were quickly taken care of.  definitely the service I was expecting from a top notch Vegas establishment.

expect to spend about $100 / person.  everything is a la carte.  entrees were about $50, sides about $10, cocktails about $15 and wine $$$$.

huge portions.  if you had any food earlier in the day,  don't expect to finish your entree, especially if you order the bone rib steak. 

enjoyed a delicious meal:
- crabcake topped with fennel and tomatoes (very good!)
- bone rib steak (lots of marbleization, good, but was not wowed)
- parmesan fillet medallion (very good!)
- parmesan truffle potato chips (soo bad, but ooh soo tasty)
- asparagus (gotta have a veggie)

Possibly the best steak I ever had. Bone in Rib steak. Definitely recommend. Place is pricey, but 5 stars. Staff was extremely helpful and nice. Had a great experience. Didn't feel at all like I was in a shopping mall in a Casino like some other Vegas spots.

Had a very nice birthday dinner here and really, really enjoyed it. The atmosphere is simple and classic, it occurred to me that they were striving to feature the food with such simple ambiance, and they succeeded. 

The service was fantastic, we had a team of servers for our party of 6 and we did not wait for a single thing throughout dinner. They did manage to find that balance between being attentive and hovering, it was perfect. Hubby and I had the table side prepared Cesar salad and it was excellent. For dinner I had the rare filet and I really enjoyed it, and the table shared the grits (my personal favorite of the entire dinner), spinach and mushrooms. For desert we had the peppermint profiteroles, which were so so (I'm not a big peppermint fan though). 

I really enjoyed dinner and highly recommend it for a nice dinner in Vegas.

We have eaten here multiple times over the years.  We have enjoyed the chef's table on 3 different occasions, including a family dinner the night before my sister-in-law got married.  

The service is wonderful and we have never had bad service in the dining room, bar or chef's table. 

The food is spectacular.  If you are a carnivore - thls is will be a religious experience.   The steaks, lamb chops, foie gras, fresh raw oysters, and 

A couple of things not to miss:
        Appetizers: N.O. barbecue shrimp,  truffle, parmesan potato chips
        Entrees:  American Buffalo ribeye, the bone-in ribeye, lamb chops
        Dessert:  brioche bread pudding, Delmonico chocolate cake

Wine List:  I swear the darn book weighs 10 pounds.  They have an extensive wine list and it can be intimidating.  I have found the sommelier  has always been approachable (some restaurants have sommeliers that are kind of snotty or stand offish) and helpful.

Adult Beverages:  I like champagne and wine but they have some really nice cocktails and I would suggest trying one or two.  
     The Lady Lychee
     A Tale of Two Cherries
     La Flor Mayor - for a little kick  

They also have an impressive list of whiskey & whisky.

There are several seating areas of the restaurant, so you can have an intimate meal, a family get together or enjoy a group of friends.  I enjoy sitting on the long bench because it is comfy and I can people watch.

If you have a special event, reserve the Chef's Table but show up hungry because they are going to FEED YOU!  No tasting size dishes and they will toss in a surprise or two.  Like the time we had a wonderful ribeye main course, and thinking we were getting dessert, in walks another main course!  A spectacular lamb chop that was the best I have ever eaten.  

And if you are just looking for some munchies and a drink - visit the bar.  Michelle is a great bartender and the food is the best bar food you will find.

Or need your Emeril dessert fix - pop into the bar and have a dessert with a vintage cocktail.

I agree with all the raves regarding the food however the restaurant itself lacks any real ambiance. Tucked away on the first floor of The Venitian we were disappointed by lack of personality given the location,  Vegas, and being so highly rated. Food, of course,  was excellent.  Loved my wilted spinach salad and the bone in ribeye was terrific.  Just anticipated more of a dining experience.

I absolutely love treated myself to an awesome steak dinner at least once a month. Was there last week for March Madness and came here with my boyfriend and a couple other friends. Our server, Frank, was amazing!!! We all felt really comfortable with him and felt at home. He made our experience very memorable. We talked about music, life, our home heritage and all sorts of stuff. I hope he's working next time we are in town. As for the food I ordered the wagyu filet which was thee best piece of meat I've ever had!!!
its about on par with craft steak...the sides were ok...the prime rib was superb...me likey

3 stars for the wine list.   2 for the steak.  I've gotta say that the service and ambiance was astounding given they let me bring my 3 foot tall yard full of long island ice tea, from the flamingo no less, to the table.  Greater than that? the wait staff were kind enough to fill it up with ice for me as I left it sitting there, as our center piece.  

The wine list was insane.  It must have been 50 pages.  In the end we ended up going with something simple because we were already pretty hammered from our fun in the sun.  The appetizers were decent from what I remember, but the anti-pasto salad looked like cold cuts from my mom's fridge.  It just wasn't presented well for the type of clout this place assumes.  So here I am, dining Euro style waiting 2 hours for the steak to finally arrive, chewing on my day old bologna and it finally arrives...

...and it sucks!  I got the bone in rib-eye, one of my favorite cuts, and it was "toasted" excessively and really lacked any distinguishable flavor!  I couldn't believe that i was paying this kind of money for a steak I was making in my BBQ baby years.  And you know how sometimes things taste so, so good when you're trashed?  I couldn't imagine my feelings had I been sober.  

But I'm not so sure it was all bad - my friends had some pretty good Filet, and the soup was good from what I understand.  It's just not going to be MY first choice for a favorite dining spot in Vegas.  Like I said though, the wait staff was great, the wine list amazing, and the silverware clean.  

Emeril - try again... and for you readers - try The Mesa Grill instead...
Outstanding service, an intimidating large wine list and great steaks.
The service was great and the food was delicious!! Make sure you go in hungry, the portions are huge!!

We were at DelMonico's last year to celebrate my boyfriend's sister's 21st birthday. That meant there were A LOT of us! The atmosphere was awesome, but then again, every restaurant in Vegas has some degree of nice ambiance, right? Anyhow, our large party wasn't able to sit together, which really sucked because we had made reservations and they expected all of us at that time. So, my boyfriend, me and his two cousins got our own mini-table. We all shared the caesar salad prepared table-side. It was seriously enough for all 4 of us, and it was very very delicious. I ordered the gumbo, and was very disappointed. I thought that gumbo would be Emeril's thing! It was slightly cold and WAY too salty. It was a nice little presentation though-- it came in a mini-pot and was poured into my bowl. 

I had the filet mignon and it was okay, and I wish I had ordered the duck. I can't really say why I only thought the filet mignon was only okay, but maybe it had to do with the fact that it was pretty salty too and I had just finished up a super salty gumbo? 

All in all, it was a fun experience because of the atmosphere and because all of the family was there. Would we have had just a good of a time had we gone somewhere else? Probably. But, this was birthday girl's choice and it was kinda fun to go to a celebrity chef's place and criticize their food. :)
Best filet of my life! I'll be back. Grits were a bit undercooked, but the steak and mushrooms made up for the oversight. Amazingly attentive and friendly waiters.

Is there an email address I can complain to about my experience somewhere? For being the priciest place we ate at during my trip to LV, this was definitely the most disappointing. Service was incredibly aloof. The food was sub-par. 

For 2 we ordered a few drinks, the Caesar salad and the Chateaubriand, both to share. The Caesar salad was delicious but how can you really go wrong with that? The main course was the absolute worst. Three pieces of meat per person, and it was barely lukewarm. I saw our server "heat" it up for maybe 3 seconds, and then take it off the grill. Although the meat was flavorful, the fact that it was almost COLD ruined the whole meal. Not only that, I asked our server to take a picture of us since it was my bday, and he handed over my camera to another server as if he was too good to take a damn picture!

At the end, we had a couple cups of coffee, and was given their birthday raspberry sorbet, which wasn't even edible. Overall NOT recommended.

I love Delmonico's, I really do.  But this past weekend, it just didn't measure up.  I should have gone with my gut and given CUT a try.  We started with drinks in the bar, which was fine.  Our table for seven was ready on time, which is always nice.  Unfortunately, our service was super average compared to what I've had in the past at Delmonico's and at other comparable high end steakhouses.  My husband and I shared a salad for an appetizer.  We let the server know this when we ordered and in the past, we've had this served on two separate plates in lieu of having to divide the salad at the table.  Unfortunately, we were given to salad plates and told we could split it ourselves.  

I love a good filet, and unfortunately, my filet was very average.  It was cooked to my liking, medium rare, but it was served relatively cool, which made me think that our food was sitting for a while before it was served.  My mom ordered seared ahi tuna which was served completely cold.  The outer edges were completely cooled after the searing, which again, tells me that our food sat out for a while.  My husband and my brother both ordered bone-in rib-eyes.  When the food was served, they brought one rib-eye that had been split in two.  The server went back to the kitchen and they realized they made a mistake and brought out the other rib-eye, while using tongs to take the half from my husband's plate and added it to my brother's plate.  Rookie move, seriously.

My family doesn't eat a ton of cards, so for sides we ordered two servings of the mushrooms, broccoli, and corn for my niece.  The server kept pushing for us to order a starch, which we insisted we didn't want- very bizarre, it's not like we weren't running up a pretty hefty tab.

It was my mom's birthday and I really thought Delmonico's would come through with an excellent experience.  The food was okay overall, but I really can't say that this meal met my expectations or anyone at our tables' expectations.  I've been to many Emeril restaurants, maybe they went through a recent management change??  I don't know, I wish I could explain the extremely average experience.

Every single thing that we have tried here was above expectations. Had the filet mignon and Colorado rack of lamb with roasted fingerling potatoes and garlic mushrooms. The filet was oh so soft and the lamb was ever so juicy! Will come back here for yet another dinner splurge.

Dinner was fabulous. The bone in ribeye was perfectly done, the filet was blue as requested, not an easily done prep-and spit on. The grits, as well as the creamed spinach very tasty. The banana cream pie a perfectly yummy dessert for two. Well worth the price.

What better place to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday and Yelp Spring Break than in Las Vegas! I wanted to surprise my bf so I made reservations through open table for dinner at Delmonico. When we arrived the hostess wished my bf a happy birthday and we were told to have a seat in the waiting room. Wow that waiting room was super nice but also packed! Lucky for us as we turned around to scan for a seat the hostess called my name and said our table was ready.

Upon being seated we were greeted by our server. He also wished my bf happy birthday and took our drink orders. When the waiter returned with our water he also brought some warm, soft, honey rolls the melted in our mouths. We decided to start with the Petite Iceberg Lettuce Wedge salad followed by a Twice Baked Potato ($9) and Rib-eye ($48) for me and Short Rib Special ($35) for my bf. Before our salads came out the waiter brought a small appetizer for us to share- compliments of the chef. I don't remember what exactly it was but it was so delicious!

The wedge salad ($13) was composed with petite iceberg lettuce wedges and topped with apple smoked bacon and red onion with buttermilk blue cheese dressing. There was A LOT of crumbled blue cheese on the salad- almost a little too much for me. It was enough for both of us to share and enjoy before we got our steak knifes and forks ready for what was to come next.

I wish I were hungrier at the time- my rib-eye was HUGE! After the rolls and salad my steak and bf's short rib looked almost impossible to finish and it was quite a challenge. The rib eye was thick, juicy and tender- served with a slice of melting butter on top. Every bite felt so sinful as it tasted so good despite how full I was I couldn't stop indulging in more. I tried my best to eat my half of the twice baked potato. It was really smooth and rich with bacon and Vermont cheddar.

I can't say much about my bf's short rib since I was too busy trying to finish my ribeye. I know he really enjoyed it and the meat was so tender it fell apart with a light brush from his fork.

After dinner the server brought my boyfriend a complementary scoop of banana sorbet for his birthday. He likes bananas but usually doesn't like banana flavored foods. The sorbet was so fresh and smooth he actually really enjoyed it and finished! With a food coma coming on and $115 later we postponed surprise #2 (dessert at Serendipity) and cabbed back to our hotel and called it a night. Who does that in Vegas!?!? 

P.S. I can't wait back to try the Creekstone Farms Naturally Raised Angus, Carved Tableside for Two with Asparagus and Garlic Smashed Potatoes. Time to start saving up again...

As part of a birthday celebration weekend for two of my cousins, a group of us decided to head to Delmonico Steakhouse for a really nice birthday dinner. We had no idea what to expect of this place, except for the high prices. 

We were running late for our reservation, but we called the restaurant letting them know we were on our way. It was a group of 6, so we really did not want to loose our reservation. They could not have been any more helpful over the phone! Directions were provided, and they kindly held our table until we arrived.

Upon arrival, we were quickly escorted to our table. Our server kindly welcomed us and wished my two cousins a very happy birthday and memorable meal. After we all ordered our entrees, we were pleasantly surprised with complimentary appetizers for the entire group (halibut ceviche which was to die for!!). Their bread rolls were extremely delicious and always kept coming. Water was always replenished without even asking. Always a step ahead those people! When it came time to receiving our entrees, the wait staff made sure that all our orders were correct before setting them on the table. The dinner was then completed with complimentary sorbet (made in house). Everything was delicious!!! No one had any complaints about anything.

The service was excellent; above and beyond my expectations of any restaurant. I have been to other restaurants like Delmonico's at The Venetian for birthday celebrations, and none match the superb service and attention of Delmonico. Despite the fact that the restaurant's prices are high, the overall experience, taste of the food, and service make it an exceptional place for any occasion.

Long overdue review! Went back in July...and swore to myself I needed to give the place kudos because we had such a lovely experience. The food was delicious...and yes, it's a steakhouse, but I'd go back just for the banana cream pie. Oh...how I long for that pie. Anyway...the standout though has got to be the service. When our steaks came, I was disappointed to see that my steak had been overcooked - but it was clearly a busy night (and it looked like they had some crazy difficult customers that night), and I'm not usually one to complain, so I figured it still tasted good, and said nothing. But the manager, Ken, was nearby, and must've seen me sort of picking and inspecting my food, and he came by to make sure things were okay. I said they were fine, but he insisted on checking it out for me -- and in the end, even though I had already taken a few bites, he brought me a whole new steak and made sure it was cooked the way I liked before he left us to dine. That is fantastic service. \n\nFood was delicious, foie gras was heavenly (damn you California for banning it!), and the service top notch.

Amazing. From the service to the food. 
We had reservations for 6 pm. And were seated almost as soon as we walked in. Everyone was friendly and our waiter was very knowledgeable with the menu. The bread and that butter with honey is amazing. 

I ordered steak, potatoes and broccoli and my bf ordered the ribs. 
We both really enjoyed our food. Even the salad was amazing. 
We will definitely we back when we R in town. 
Bookmarked for the future (: I highly recommend this restaurant

We had to come back here again on our most recent visit to Vegas. It was as good as we remember it. The lobster bisque, filet, and chocolate souffl did not disappoint. The only minor complaint I have this time is with the cocktails. Too much ice and no garnish. For the type of restaurant it is, it should also not be using regular ice cubes from an ice machine. The drinks should not only taste good, but look delicious as well. \nI would not hesitate to come back here.

We ordered the Chateau Brian and it was awesome!  The steak cheese fondue is to die for.  Quality of beef was very good.  Service is good beside the fact that there is a huge party in front of us.  LOL.  One of the best steakhouse in Vegas I would say.  Will come back during slower, non-trade show time to experience better service.

Out of all the fabulous restaurants this hold one of the top rank on my mind.  That's a lot to be said.

Next time we're in Vegas we'll be sure make a stop here.  Make your reservation because this place is pack!

Screaming toddlers ruined it. 

We have been coming here for a couple of years but tonight I couldn't believe that 1) they actually had high chairs and 2) people would be so inconsiderate to bring toddlers to this restaurant. 

The food and service was impeccable as always but if you're paying $200+ for a meal you don't want kids banging silverware and having tantrums. 

While we love it here we will consider coming much later or somewhere else completely for a nice quiet adult dinner. 

Dear parents, don't bring your kids here. Don't bring your kids to a casino. Disneyland is 3 hours a way. Go there instead.

Fantastic food, great service.  Much more expensive than what we usually spend on dinner, but so yummy and worth it!  We both had steak for dinner, with sides of salad in the sherry ving., garlic smashed potatoes, and the pecan pie.  I wish we had room to finish the pecan pie, but could only get through half.

In Vegas a few nights seeking a great steak dinner. The petit filet mignon was yummy! Also a great individual portion, anything else simply too large. Dinner rolls the best !! Also the truffle pasta appetizer is a must try! Waiters provided good service too.
Food was amazing!! Portions were big (especially steak).  One of the better steakhouses in Vegas.  A bit pricey but at least the food is delicious!

The BEST steakhouse ever. The perfect amount of seasoning/flavor and a nice huge cut of perfectly cooked bone-in ribeye earns this establishment a 5 from me. every time I eat at a different steakhouse I always compare it to Delmonico's. Some other steakhouses in LV might hold a higher rating from "professional reviewers", but seriously, they don't hold a candle to this joint.

The decor is plain but that's not why you come here. You go to Delmonico for the great steaks, sides and yummy desserts. This place is almost always five stars for me but this last visit I made then mistake and deviated from my normal order of filet mignon and did the surf and turf special instead. The lobster was good (not sure if I would say amazing since it was slathered in bearnaise sauce) but the steak was only so-so; not up to normal Delmonico quality. Covering it in the amazing house steak sauce did help but I wouldn't recommend ordering the surf and turf.

I have been coming to this place for the last five years and it never disappoints.  One of my Vegas go to dining spots.  Visited last Thursday again.  A few favorites:

Arrive early and visit Max the Bartender.  Just recently learned he is a world class mixologist (after ordering wine for years) and will create beverages that will make your head spin.  Has his own bitters collection to add a custom touch.  Tequila Gumption he made me was world class.

I always get the Filet Pittsburgh Style and it is exceptional.  Not too loaded down with butter and just the right flavor.  If I am steaked out, The Salmon dish is incredible.  Creamed Corn is to die for with jalapeno seasoning topping (I am hyper critical of creamed corn but thing D's and STK are two of the best).  Biscuits that they serve are out of this world.  Potato chips with truffle oil are a nice indulgence.  Caprese salad is a great starter.  Like the wine list and not over priced like Del Frisco and the Wynn or Bellagio spots.

Finish it off with a double espresso and you are ready to venture on into the evening.

I prefer to sit in the main room and the seating towards the back is preferred.  Lamont is the best server by far.

The best service I had was here during my time in Las Vegas. The al a cart sides were large enough to share family style. My filet was overcooked and the server had another one out to me in minutes. The martinis were wonderful in chilled glasses with blue cheese olives. The table settings beautiful.

Best meal EVER! (also the most expensive...but worth it).\n\nThe food was just unbelieveable. We had a special gnocchi/lump crab appetizer, wedge salad, filet & ribeye, roasted potatoes w/garlic, and pecan pie for dessert. Food coma! Everything was absolutely perfect and the service was excellent. Highly recommended for a special occasion.

Last night I had the salmon with a side of grits followed up by that he banana cream pie. It is amazing how good food can be! Just loved it. The food is pricey but if you want to give yourself a treat then this is the place to go.

I came for a restaurant week lunch with my two lovelies, Sandra and David and my husband joined before he headed to work. This 3 course was $30.15.

The 3 of us not working that day ordered beverages. This place made my heart sing because they had a Whisky BOOK. To be handed pages upon pages to browse on top of the other spirits, wine menu AND cocktail menus made my damn head spin because I wanted a lot of things. I settled on getting the Scarlet Starlet which had Glenmorangie 10, Tuaca, lime, hibiscus, strawberry and egg whites. It was totally up my alley - very much the scotch shined then the balance of the rest of the ingredients came through. Very much worth the $16 in alcohol and skill in mixing- the bartender Michelle was great.

Appetizer I got VINE-RIPENED HEIRLOOM TOMATO SALAD (With Burrata Cheese, Red onion, Balsamic Vinegar and Torn Local Basil) which was standard, but good because the components were quality and fresh. 

Entree I got PAN ROASTED ATLANTIC SALMON( With Sweet Corn & Crab Vinaigrette and Fresh Basil) which was nicely cooked and was very fresh and clean. I liked the large pieces of lump crab mixed in with the corn. 

Dessert the hubby and I shared:

BANANA CREAM PIE PARFAIT(Caramel Sauce, Chocolate Shavings, Whipped Cream and Graham Crumbs) was a solid dessert that could convince someone who doesnt like banana cream. The custard in it was creamy while still being light. 

TRADITIONAL BREAD PUDDING(With Warm Caramel Pecan Sauce) I love bread pudding and this was good, but average. I do appreciate that the caramel was flavorful while not being saccharine sweet.

I thought it was a solid lunch, but I am coming back for drinks as there's very few places on the strip I've enjoyed the beverage offerings as this. Fantastic beverage program for the libation lover.

Five Star food and Five Star service! Fantastic beef and you have to try the banana pie!\nI know that every restaurant has a bad day, but some of the bad reviews I read are completely ridiculous. My guess is that either too much alcohol was consumed by people complaining and/or these reviews come from people that think food trucks are fine dining.\nPrices are very reasonable for the great food and service. This is a must try when visiting Vegas.

Minimalist decor, maximalist flavor!  the dry-aged ribeye steak was a marvel of cut and cure, and flawlessly prepared with a lump of butter oozing over the edges (as if the marbled steak didn't have enough cholesterol to make me reach for a double hit of pravastatin!) I generally order beef cooked medium-well which tends to dry out the meat; however the chefs here knew what they were doing and delivered the most fork tender medium well i have ever eaten!  The maitre'd oversaw the dining sequence and operation with panache, though the grim-faced waiters could have used a few lessons on how to develop an engaging personality.  The prices were reasonable for Vegas top flight restaurants.

Great food, great staff.  Came for a steak, a steak is what I got.  Sides were amazing but not needed especially after my soup.  Never had to ask for water, never had to fill up my own wine glass.  Staff was excellent.  Knew before hand about dietary needs and overcame them.  I would defiantly recommend if you coming or stating near the palazzo.

f you are going to eat here the only suggestion as mentioned before is to go with the Porterhouse. You will not regret it! At $85 the price is a bit of a turn off and there are other nice cuts available around a $50 range. Although, at 32 oz and being one of the best steaks I ever had in my life it was well worth it. Service was also fairly good although not superb. Very professional staff but during the busy dinner hours are not the most attentive.\n\nI made my reservations well in advance on the Venetian website and did not have to wait a minute to be seated.

I had better expectations for this place based on the reviews.  I ordered the bone in ribeye, which was touted as their "signature dish".  The meat was not well marbled and was quite gristly for the price.  The quality of meat was comparable to an Outback or Black Angus.

Such a disappointment!  Here in Vegas with family, we're all a bit of foodies and selected Delmonicos for its reputation as a great steakhouse.  We've dined at other Emeril restaurants and been very pleased, including another Delmonicos location.  The ambiance of the restaurant was considerably lacking.  You expect a steakhouse to have that rich dark woods atmosphere.  This was very bland and nondescript in a city that does things to an excess..  The steak, a bone in ribeye was good but not OMG.  Barbecue shrimp appetizer and popovers were delicious.  Side dishes including the Au gratin potatoes were fair.  Banana cream pie is a must have.  The freezing cold restaurant added to the disappointment.

Came back here with in a month just to show my wife the deliciousniss of the lobster bisque...it was just as good the 2nd time...too bad during lunch..they don't give the lobster as  a garnish as they do during dinner.  \n\nLunch service was ok...you can tell the difference from the dinner service.  But the food was good still.  I did want to try the lobster sliders....some one else go that and it looked pretty good...you get 2 sliders.  I had the pasta dish during lunch but the flavors was a bit bland and the dish was forgetable.

Service was great but being a steakhouse, I would have expected a lot better steaks! Table ordered 1 filet, 3 ribeyes and a New York - meat lacked seasoning, dry and 3 of the 5 were overcooked! Side dishes were okay. Best thing was the wedge salad! Definitely not a place I would return!

Best pecan pie ever!\nShrimp cocktail, good but nothing special, I thought it would be more Cajun. Oysters fresh and the horseradish was so good! Lobster bisque very good. The steak was pretty good I had a filet mignon and my husband had the Ribeye it was huge! Everything was cooked well. I have had a better steak but it was good. The best thing was the dessert of pecan pie. I'm just going to go there for that!

I usually only Yelp a location when I either have something negative to say (sad but true) or when I think I'm being witty. lol 

Today, for what I think is the first time, I'm Yelping because I'm just so incredibly impressed. EVERYTHING was delicious. Amazing. My husband got the bone in rib eye and I got the filet mignon.... so good. Sides were twice baked potato (better than my mom's, sorry mom) and cream corn. Literally some of the best food I've ever had. Great service too. 

Expensive, yes. But very well worth it. :)

In my opinion it's not fit for a foodie. Meal was very good but not superb. However, service was great. I wasn't impressed by their BBQ shrimp which was highly recommended as their signature appetizer.  Fish was cooked perfectly but most of the food only had 2 dimensions.  I expected more complexity and excitement in their flavors. Overall great for a cocktail and a good meal but Las Vegas has so many places in this category. I would love a large well known restaurant on the strip to go above and beyond. 

If you aren't adventurous and just want a good meal with all your great basics on the menu this is perfect. It's a crowd pleaser but definitely lacking in excitement. 

If I were to rate the food it would only be 3 stars but the service is very good so I gave them 4 stars. I will be back for drinks but it wouldn't be my first choice for food.

I blame my father for my inordinate love of all things gourmet. Thankfully, I appreciate a good burrito as much as I appreciate a good steak, but I will definitely seize every opportunity to dine in style as much as I can.

Thanks to a family trip to Vegas, I got to eat at Emeril's, once more partaking our family's favorite pasttime: eating. We had eaten at the original location in New Orleans when I lived there, and it was one of my top 5 dining experiences of all time. This one definitely tied that experience.

As other people have said, if you're not going to eat steak in some form when you come here, you're wasting your time. The steak is truly a peak experience for meat lovers. We all ate our  steaks in silence, save for the "OMG!" and "MMMM!" and "wow.wow.wow."  They all had the filet mignon, and I had the bone-in dry aged ribeye: the best steak I have ever eaten in my life. It came on a bed of perfectly creamy garlic mashed potatoes and foie gras butter just melting into it. 

Have you ever had lightly tempura battered asparagus? It's worth coming here just to try them. 

Even the sides- delicious spinach he made without cream that was STILL good (shocking, I know), and broccoli cooked to perfection...we all kept remarking how absolutely everything was just perfect.

The other thing that distinguishes restaurants like this is the service.  Places like this are in a whole other league- waiters who seem to read your mind, appearing and disappearing before you even realized you needed something - never interrupting conversation, never hovering, always classy and helpful. Our waiter chose the perfect wine for us with with the vague descriptions of what we were looking for, and it truly was the best complement to our meals ever. 

The design of the room is also a refreshing breath of fresh air from all the gaudy glitz and obnoxious 'bigness' of Vegas; simple, clean lines and understated elegance and chairs that make it seem like your table is totally self-contained and isolated from the other tables. Great to have that feeling of privacy.

We lingered for hours just basking in the glow of such perfection and decadence.

He may be a TV celebrity chef, but you can't take away credit where credit is due: Emeril is a fantastic restaurateur.  My wife and I have dined here twice; the first time because we were staying at the Venetian and the second time we purposely came back to eat here on one of our anniversaries while staying in Vegas.  In short this is a fantastic formal steakhouse experience all around.  What sold us was the Chateaubriand for two. Expertly cooked and finished off by table side with a flame of cognac for that over-the-top Vegas style experience.  Quite possibly one of the most memorable steaks we've had in our life. Tender with an explosion of flavor when you take a bite, mmm.  There are several wonderful side dishes you can choose to complement the meat and so far we haven't been disappointed in any of them whether you go for the vegetable of the day (garlic pan fried green beans the last time were there) or the bacon and cheddar grits, mashed potatoes, or baked potato. Oh and for your prerequisite greenery before the meat course they also do a fantastic Caesar salad prepared at table side for 2 as well.  Desert? Yes please!  You can't go wrong with their caramel cream brulee but everything on their dessert menu looked sweetly decadent.  I don't think I need bother describing the wine or drink menu here other than this is Vegas after all and if you possibly couldn't find what you're after here to complement your meal then I'm sure they could get it for you.
Went here for guys weekend. Unbelievable. Ravioli app was so good. The steak was very good too. When getting a good bottle of wine, make sure they decant it for you...had to ask.

This is one of the most amazing restaurant I've ever had. I made a reservation for Fourth of July for my boyfriend's birthday. The service was 5 stars, my water was never below one sip level. We had three servers for our table. I've been waiting for their bone in ribeye as review said it was good. It was better than I expected. We had two appetizers beef cappacio and table side  Caesar salad, halibut, delicious! And caramel cake dessert was perfect. The servers had also given us a birthday banana walnut ice cream. Highly recommend this place!

Meh. Just .. meh. For the price we paid, I expected better food, and better service.

Although my steak was cooked properly, my husband's steak was not. The service was slow and not especially friendly.

Honestly, save your money - you can get better steak, better service, and better drinks at Ruth's Chris.

One of the top steak places I've had in Vegas aside from STK and CraftSteak! 

My friends and I started off with the steak tartare and truffle chips which were on point! It was shareable between the four of us and held us over until our steaks! They gave us complimentary bread that was so warm and slightly crispy....it was heavenly! 

I ordered the NYS, medium well and it came out perfectly cooked with garlic butter on top. The steak was huge and I was able to eat 3/4!! Honestly, all top steak places in Vegas taste the same to me due to the high quality meats they use but what I look for in these restaurants are the quality and taste in the sides and appetizers!
